contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "May we always praise the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: May the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ be praised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if God comforts us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if we are comforted

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "crushed" refers to the feeling of despair. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The troubles we experienced completely crushed us" or "We were in complete despair" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: We were so completely crushed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the gracious favor which God has given to us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the gracious favor given to us

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the very one whom I had hurt" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the very one who was hurt by me

contextId.occurrenceNote: Paul is speaking about the behavior of certain Corinthian believers who caused him emotional pain. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those who should have made me rejoice might not hurt me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I might not be hurt by those who should have made me rejoice

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. The word "punishment" can be translated using a verb. Alternate translation: "The way that the majority has punished that person is enough" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: This punishment of that person by the majority is enough

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means to have a strong emotional response of too much sorrow. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "too much sorrow does not overwhelm him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he is not overwhelmed by too much sorrow

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I have forgiven it for your sake" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it is forgiven for your sake

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those whom God has saved" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who are saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the ones whom God is saving" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the ones being saved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as people whom God has sent" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as we are sent from God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form with "Christ" as the implied subject. Alternate translation: "which Christ has written on our hearts" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: written on our hearts

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that all people can know and read" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: γινωσκομένη καὶ ἀναγινωσκομένη ὑπὸ πάντων ἀνθρώπων
contextId.glQuote: known and read by all people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "It is not a letter that people wrote with ink but a letter that the Spirit of the living God wrote" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: It was written not with ink but by the Spirit of the living God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "It is not a letter that people engraved on stone tablets but a letter that the Spirit of the living God wrote on tablets of human hearts" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-ellipsis]])
contextId.glQuote: It was not written on tablets of stone, but on tablets of human hearts

contextId.occurrenceNote: "carved into stone with letters." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that God carved into stone with letters" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: engraved in letters on stones

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. AT "the law which God once made glorious" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that which was once made glorious

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here both occurrences of the word "it" refer to "the same veil." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one removes the veil, because only in Christ does God remove it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It has not been removed, because only in Christ is it taken away

contextId.occurrenceNote: God gives them the ability to understand. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God lifts the veil away" or "God gives them the ability to understand" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the veil is taken away

contextId.occurrenceNote: The Spirit is changing believers to be glorious like him. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The Lord is transforming us into his same glorious likeness" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: We are being transformed into the same glorious likeness

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if a veil covers our gospel, that veil covers it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: εἰ ἔστιν κεκαλυμμένον τὸ εὐαγγέλιον ἡμῶν, ἐστὶν κεκαλυμμένον
contextId.glQuote: if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People afflict us in every way" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: We are afflicted in every way

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People persecute us but God does not forsake us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: We are persecuted but not forsaken

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People strike us down but do not destroy us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: We are struck down but not destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "other people may see the life of Jesus in our bodies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the life of Jesus also may be shown in our bodies

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this phrase in [2 Corinthians 4:10](../04/10.md). Alternate translation: "so other people may see the life of Jesus in our body" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἵνα ἡ ζωὴ τοῦ Ἰησοῦ φανερωθῇ ἐν σαρκὶ ἡμῶν
contextId.glQuote: so that the life of Jesus may be shown in our body

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as the one who wrote these words" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: according to that which was written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as God spreads his grace to many people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as grace is spread to many people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God is renewing our inward being more each day" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: inwardly we are being renewed day by day

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "things that we can see ... things that we cannot see" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: things that are seen ... things that are unseen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "if people destroy the earthly dwelling that we live in" or "if people kill our bodies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: if the earthly dwelling that we live in is destroyed

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "house" means the same thing as "building from God." Here "hands" is a synecdoche that represents the human as a whole. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "It is a house that humans did not make" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: It is a house not made by human hands

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "we will not be naked" or "God will not find us naked" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we will not be found to be naked

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that life may swallow up what is mortal" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the things he has done in the physical body" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the things done in the body

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God clearly sees what kind of people we are" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: What we are is clearly seen by God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God has appointed us as Christ's representatives" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we are appointed as representatives of Christ

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Let God reconcile you to himself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Be reconciled to God

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "discredited" refers to people speaking badly about Paul's ministry, and working against the message he proclaims. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "we do not want anyone to be able to speak badly about our ministry" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we do not wish our ministry to be discredited

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People accuse us of being deceitful" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: We are accused of being deceitful

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as if people did not know us and yet people still know us well" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as if we were unknown and we are still well known

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "We work as if people are punishing us for our actions but not as if they have condemned us to death" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: We work as being punished for our actions but not as condemned to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "We have not restrained you" or "We have not given you any reason to stop loving us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You are not restrained by us

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "your own hearts are restraining you" or "you have stopped loving us for your own reasons" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you are restrained in your own hearts

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "set yourselves apart" or "allow me to set you apart" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be set apart

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You fill me with comfort" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I am filled with comfort

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "we experienced trouble in every way" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: we were troubled in every way

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "not because what I said in my letter distressed you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: not because you were distressed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that someone should carry out justice" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that justice should be done

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that you would know that your good will toward us is sincere" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your good will toward us should be made known to you in the sight of God

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "this" refers to the way the Corinthians responded to Paul's previous letter, as he described in the previous verse. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "This is what encourages us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is by this that we are encouraged

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "spirit" refers to a person's temperament and disposition. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "all of you refreshed his spirit" or "all of you made him stop worrying" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: ἀναπέπαυται τὸ πνεῦμα αὐτοῦ ἀπὸ πάντων ὑμῶν
contextId.glQuote: his spirit was refreshed by all of you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the grace that God has given to the churches of Macedonia" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.quote: τὴν χάριν τοῦ Θεοῦ τὴν δεδομένην ταῖς ἐκκλησίαις τῆς Μακεδονίας
contextId.glQuote: the grace of God that has been given to the churches of Macedonia

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that you may relieve others and burden yourselves" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that others may be relieved and you may be burdened

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here Paul quotes from Exodus. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "as Moses wrote" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: as it is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the brother whom believers among all of the churches praise" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the brother who is praised among all of the churches

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the churches also selected him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he also was selected by the churches

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the churches have sent them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are sent by the churches

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "not as something that we forced you to give" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: not as something extorted

contextId.occurrenceNote: "This is just as it is written." This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "This is just as the writer wrote" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It is as it is written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will enrich you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: You will be enriched

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Because this service has tested and proven you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Because of your being tested and proved by this service

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom the Lord approves" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who is approved

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one will be able to make me stop boasting and stay silent" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: this boasting of mine will not be silenced

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that people will think that they are like us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: they are found to be doing the same work that we are doing

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people beat me with wooden rods" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I was beaten with rods

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people threw stones at me until they thought I was dead" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I was stoned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "some people put me in a basket and lowered me to the ground" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I was lowered in a basket

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God gave me a thorn in the flesh" or "God allowed me to have a thorn in the flesh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a thorn in the flesh was given to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it is praise that you should have given me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I should have been praised by you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form, with emphasis on the "signs." Alternate translation: "It is the true signs of an apostle that I performed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The true signs of an apostle were performed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated as active. Alternate translation: "Believe that someone has done something wrong only after two or three people have said the same thing" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Every accusation must be established by the evidence of two or three witnesses

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be made active. Alternate translation: "they crucified him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was crucified
